words.def: servant, worshipper, slave. Muslims consider themselves servants and worshippers of God. Common Muslim names such as Abdullah (Servant of God), Abdul-Malik (Servant of the King), Abdur-Rahmān (Slave of the most Beneficent), Abdus-Salām (Slave of [the originator of] Peace), Abdur-Rahîm (Slave of the most Merciful), all refer to names of Allah.
words.name: ʿAbd (عبد) (for male) ʾAmah (أمة) (for female)

words.def: Traditionally describes good manners, as in etiquette. For example, being courteous is good ʾadab. However, the term can be used very broadly, and the proper translation would be "the proper way to go about something," as in the example, ʾĀdāb al Qitāl, or, "The Proper Ways of Fighting in War," (Qitāl in Arabic means mortal combat) in which the word "etiquette" does not befit the context. A secondary meaning of ʾAdab is "literature".
words.name: ʾAdab (أدب)

words.def: call to salat (prayer), sometimes alternatively spelled and pronounced Azan, Athan and Adhan.
words.name: ʾAdhān (أذان)

words.def: justice, especially distributive justice: social, economic, political, environmental.
words.name: ʿAdl (عدل)

words.def: Anno Hegirae The Islamic calendar starts counting years starting from the time when Muhammad had to leave Mecca and go to Medina, an event known as the Hijra. The first day of the first Islamic year is 1 Muḥarram 1 (AH) and corresponds to 16 July 622 (CE).
words.name: AH (هجرية)

words.def: literally "one." Islamically, ahad means One Alone, unique, none like God. Al-Ahad is one of the names of God.
words.name: ʾAḥad (أحد)

words.def: These are rulings and orders of the Qu'ran and Sunnah. A single ruling is called a Ḥukm. Five kinds of orders: Wajib or Fard (obligatory), Mustahab (preferred and recommended), Halal or Mubah (permissible), Makruh (disliked and not recommended), and Haram (forbidden)
words.name: ʾAḥkām (أحكام)

words.def: members of Muhammad's Household. Also known among Shia as the Maʿṣūmūn (معصومون) (infallibles; spiritually pure).
words.name: ʾAhl al-Bayt (أهل البيت )

words.def: people who live in ignorance of the teachings of a revealed religion, but according to the "Fitra", the "Natural Religion" innate to human nature as created by God.
words.name: ʾAhl al-Fatrah ( أهل الفترة)

words.def: "People of the Book", or followers of pre-Islamic monotheistic religions with some form of scripture believed to be of divine origin which were mentioned in Quran: Jews, Christians.
words.name: ʾAhl al-Kitāb (أهل الكتاب )

words.def: hereafter or eternal life
words.name: ʾĀkhirah (الآخرة)

words.def: The practice of virtue. Morals.
words.name: ʾAkhlāq (أخلاق)

words.def: Sincerity and genuineness in religious beliefs.
words.name: Al-ʾIkhlāṣ (الإخلاص)

words.def: Piety and righteousness and every act of obedience to Allah.
words.name: Al-Bir (البّر)

words.def: Literally "worlds", humankind, jinn, angels and all that exists.
words.name: ʿĀlamīn (عالمين)

words.def: A semi-circular wall north-west of Kaaba.
words.name: Al Hijr (Kaaba)

words.def: "Peace be upon him" This expression normally follows after naming a prophet (other than Muhammad), or one of the noble Angels (i.e. Jibreel (Gabriel), Meekaal (Michael), etc.)
words.name: ʿalayhi -s-salām (عليه السلام)

words.def: "Praise be to God!" Qur'anic exclamation and also same meaning as hallelujah.
words.name: al-ḥamdu li-llāh (الحمد لله)

words.def: The Arabic name of God.
words.name: Allāh (الله)

words.def: "Dear God..."
words.name: Allāhumma (اللَّهُمَّ)

words.def: "God is Greater (than anything or anyone, imaginable or unimaginable)" Islamic expression.
words.name: Allāhu ʾAkbar (الله أكبر)

words.def: One who knows. A scholar (in any field of knowledge); a scientist (who knows science) or a theologian (who knows religion); similar to Japanese sensei, "teacher".
words.name: ʿĀlim (عالِم)

words.def: the trust. Of all creation, only human beings & jinns carry the "trust", which is free will.
words.name: ʾAmānah (أمانة)

words.def: Amen.
words.name: ʾĀmīn (آمين)

words.def: "Commander of the Faithful" Historically the title of the Caliph. In some modern countries like Morocco, a ʾAmīr ul-Muʾminīn or Commander of the faithful is the religious chief.
words.name: ʾAmīr ul-Muʾminīn (أمير المؤمنين)

words.def: Muhammad's mother. Aminah fell sick and died in Abwa, near Madina (then Yathrib) when Muhammad was six years old.
words.name: ʾĀminah (آمنة)

words.def: Islamic doctrine of enjoining right. There exists in Islam the (obligatory) principle of encouraging other people to do the right thing.
words.name: Al-ʾAmr Bi'l Maʿrūf (الأمر بالمعروف)

words.def: Spoils of war. (See Sūrat al-ʾAnfāl (8:1)) (سورة الأنفال)[1]
words.name: ʾAnfāl (أنفال)

words.def: "Helpers." The Muslim converts at Medina who helped the Muslims from Mecca after the Hijrah.
words.name: ʾAnṣār (أنصار)

words.def: Article of faith, tenet, creed, or dogma.
words.name: ʿAqīdah (عقيدة)

words.def: Islamic practice of shaving the head of the newborn male and contributing the weight in silver for charity as well as 2 lambs.
words.name: ʿAqīqah (عقيقة)

words.def: Intelligence, intellect, mind, understanding
words.name: ʿAql (عقل)

words.def: The five rukn "pillars" of Islam. (See rukn)
words.name: ʾArkān singular rukn (ركن/أركان)

words.def: This acronym evokes a blessing and is appended to the names of the prophets who came before Muhammad. It will also be applied to the mothers of those prophets. When following a woman's name, the feminine form is ʿAlayha s-salām.
words.name: A.S. (ʿAlayhi s-salām) (عليه السلام)

words.def: Root, origin, source; principle.
words.name: ʾAṣl ( أصل ) (pl. ʾuṣūl)

words.def: "Submit to Islam" (See dawah)
words.name: ʾaslim taslam (أسلِم تسلَم)

words.def: List of God's 99 names. According to a hadith, the one who enumerates them all will enter Paradise.
words.name: ʾAsmāʾ Allāh al-Ḥusnā (أسماء الله الحسنى)

words.def: The third salat prayer. The time of the day before sunset and after noon. Also means "era".
words.name: ʿAṣr (العصر)

words.def: The bridge by crossing which it is determined (judged) whether a person would go to heaven or hell. How a person crosses the Sirat depends on what they have done in their life and what they have believed in.
words.name: Aṣ-Ṣirāṭ (الصراط)

words.def: The ten companions of Muhammad who were promised paradise (only in Sunni Islam)
words.name: al-ʿAsharatu Mubashsharun bil-Jannah or just ʿAsharatu Mubashsharah (Arabic: العشرة المبشّرون بالجنة‎, translit. ʿAsharatu l-mubashshirūn‎ or Arabic: عشرة المبشّر‎, translit. Asharatul-mubashshirūna bil Jannah‎)

words.def: Tenth day of the month of Muharram. It is the day God saved Moses and the children of Israel from the Pharaoh. The grandson of the prophet Muhammad, Imam Hussayn sacrificed his life along with 72 of his companions on the sand dunes of Karbala. Sunni Scholars recommended to fast during this day. To the Shias, it is also a day on which they mourn the death of the third Shia Imam, Husayn ibn Ali, along with his family and companions, who were killed in the famous battle in Karbala. They cry and weep and organize lamentating programmes where they not only learn how to live a proper Islamic life and improve their Spiritual Self but also cry at the end of the ritual to show their true love and faith towards imam Hussayn.
words.name: ʿĀshūrāʾ (عاشوراء)

words.def: The Islamic greeting; literally "Peace be upon you"; In addition, wa-Raḥmatullāhi wa-Barakātuhu (ورحمة الله وبركاته) means "and the Mercy of God and His blessing". The response to this greeting is wa-ʿAlaykum as-Salām wa-Raḥmatullāhi wa-Barakātuhu (وعليكم السلام ورحمة الله وبركاته) --"And on you be the Peace and Mercy of God and His Blessing".
words.name: As-Salāmu ʿAlaykum (السلام عليكم)

words.def: "I seek forgiveness from God." Islamic expression.
words.name: ʾAstaghfir allāh (أستغفر الله)

words.def: "I seek refuge in God". This is a paraphrase on the beginnings of the two last suras in the Qur'an.
words.name: Aʿudhu billah (أعوذ بالله ʾAʿūdhu billāh)

words.def: Friends, protectors, helpers, caretaker, maintainer. (singular: wali)
words.name: ʾAwliyāʾ (أولياء)

words.def: The parts of the body, male or female, must be covered in public but not between spouses, such as, body parts must be concealed of a woman before non-related men.(Non-related men means those she can marry lawfully).
words.name: ʿAwrah (عورة)

words.def: A sign. More specifically, a verse in the Qur'an.
words.name: ʾĀyah (آية), plural ʾāyāt (آيات)

words.def: Sign of God Title given to highly ranked religious scholars in Sh'ia sect.
words.name: Āyatullāh (آية الله, also spelled Ayatollah)

words.def: See Bay'ah
words.name: Baiʿa (بيعة)

words.def: see Bāṭil
words.name: Baatil (باطل)

words.def: A mosque, literally "house of God". Specifically means the Ka'aba at Makkah (Mecca).
words.name: Baitullāh (بيت الله baytu -llāh)

words.def: a form of blessing.
words.name: Barakah (بركة)

words.def: may Allah bless you; response to expression of thanks.
words.name: Bārak Allāhu Fīkum (بارك الله فيكم)

words.def: Barrier. Used in the Qur'an to describe the barrier between sweet and salty water. In theology, the one-way barrier between the mortal realm and the spirit world which the deceased soul crosses and waits for qiyamah judgment.
words.name: Barzakh (برزخ)

words.def: humankind, mankind, man, human(s), etc.
words.name: Bashar (بشر)

words.def: Insight, discernment, perceptivity, deep knowledge. Sometimes used by Sufis to denote the ability to directly perceive a transcendental Truth.
words.name: Baṣīrah (بصيرة)

words.def: void
words.name: Bāṭil (باطل)

words.def: The interior or hidden meaning. A person who devotes himself to studying such hidden meanings is a batini.
words.name: Bāṯin (باطن)

words.def: Blessed be His Name – acronym for S.A.W.S. See P.B.U.H (Peace Be Upon Him).
words.name: B.B.H.N. (عليه الصلاة والسلام)

words.def: Innovation in religion, i.e. inventing new methods of worship. Bad Bidʿahs in Islam are considered a deviation and a serious sin by many Muslims.
words.name: Bidʿah (بدعة)

words.def: Inquiry prohibited in Islam.
words.name: Bidʿah sayyiʾah (بدعة سيئة)

words.def: "In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful".[2]
words.name: Bismi-llāhi r-raḥmāni r-raḥīmi (بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم)

words.def: In general terms, it means a "cloak" or "outer garment". Specific reference is to the "burda" of the Prophet Muḥammad (see Qaṣīda al-Burda).
words.name: Burda (بردة)

words.def: an oath of allegiance to a leader, traditionally the Caliph or Imam.
words.name: Bayʿah (بيعة)

words.def: literally successor; refers to the successor of the Prophet Muhammad, the ruler of an Islamic theocracy.
words.name: Caliph (خَليفة) khalīfah

words.def: atheist – from the root ad dahr meaning time. In Islam, atheists are seen as those who think that time only destroys, hence the term ad dahriyyah for the concept of atheism.
words.name: Dahri (دهري)

words.def: an Islamic figure similar to the Antichrist; means "liar" or "deceiver".
words.name: Dajjāl (دجّال)

words.def: going astray.
words.name: Ḍallāl (ضلال)

words.def: the Ottoman Empire's relationship with its Christian tributary states.
words.name: Dār al-ʿAhd (دار العهد)

words.def: means house of safety; refers to status of a Muslim living in some of the Western world.
words.name: Dār al-ʾAmn (دار الأمن)

words.def: a region where Islam has recently been introduced.
words.name: Dār ad-daʿwa (دار الدعوة)

words.def: means house of war; refers to areas outside Muslim rule at war with Muslim states.
words.name: Dār al-ḥarb (دار الحرب)

words.def: the abode, or land, of Islam.
words.name: Dār al-Islām (دار الإسلام)

words.def: means domain of disbelief; the term originally refers to the Quraish-dominated society of Mecca between Prophet Mohammed's (s.a.w.s.) flight to Medina (the Hijra) and the city's conquest.
words.name: Dār al-Kufr (دار الكفر)

words.def: domain of agreement
words.name: Dār aṣ-Ṣulḥ ( دارالصلح )

words.def: See Dar al-Amn
words.name: Dār ash-shahāda (دار الشهادة)

words.def: blessing
words.name: Darūd (الدرود، الصلاة على النبي)

words.def: the call to Islam, proselytizing.
words.name: Daʿwah (الدعوة)

words.def: an initiate of the Sufi Path, one who practices Sufism
words.name: Darwīš (درويش)

words.def: A devotional practice whereby the name of God is repeated in a rhythmical manner. Remembrance of God; spiritual exercise; Muslims believe that the primary function of prophets is to remind people of God.
words.name: Dhikr (ذكر)

words.def: "protected person"; Jews and Christians (and sometimes others,[3] such as Buddhists, Sikhs, Hindus, and Zoroastrians), living in an Islamic state who must pay special taxes and whose right to practice their religion is subject to strict control under Islamic law.
words.name: Dhimmi (ذمّي) (pl. dhimam)

words.def: the second obligatory daily prayer.
words.name: Dhuhr (ظهر) (ẓuhr)

words.def: (literally 'religion') the way of life based on Islamic revelation; the sum total of a Muslim's faith and practice. Dīn is often used to mean the faith and religion of Islam.
words.name: Dīn (الدين)

words.def: "blood money", recompense for loss of a life.
words.name: Diyyah (دية)

words.def: personal prayer, supplication
words.name: Duʿāʾ (دعاء)

words.def: The physical Universe, as opposed to the Hereafter; sometimes spelled Dunia.
words.name: Dunya (دنيا)

words.def: divine grace
words.name: Fadl

words.def: Wicked evil doers. Plural of "fājir" (فاجر).
words.name: Fajarah (فجرة) (also fujjār (فجّار))

words.def: dawn, early morning, and the morning prayer. The time of the day when there is light in the horizon before sunrise.
words.name: Fajr (فجر)

words.def: deliverance, salvation, well-being.
words.name: Falāḥ (فلاح)

words.def: "philosophy" The methods and content of Greek philosophy which were brought into Islam. A person who tries to interpret Islam through rationalist philosophy was called a faylasuf (فيلسوف), "philosopher".
words.name: Falsafah (فلسفة)

words.def: Sufi term meaning extinction – to die to this life while alive. Having no existence outside of God.
words.name: Fanā' (فناء)

words.def: One who has a deep understanding of Islam, its laws, and jurisprudence. (see fiqh)
words.name: Faqīh (فقيه)(pl. fuqahāʾ)(فقهاء)

words.def: the return of the Shia Mahdi
words.name: Al-Faraj (الفرج)

words.def: a religious duty, or an obligatory action: praying 5 times a day is fard Neglecting a fard will result in a punishment in the hereafter. (See wajib)
words.name: Farḍ (فرض), plural furūḍ (فروض)

words.def: obligatory on every individual Muslim to aid in any way he can.
words.name: Farḍ ʿain ( فرض عين)

words.def: an obligation on the Muslim community as a whole, from which some are freed if others take it up such as for jihad.
words.name: Farḍ kifāyah (فرض كفاية)

words.def: corrupt, invalid/violable (in Islamic finance)
words.name: Fāsid (فاسد)

words.def: anyone who has violated Islamic law; usually refers to one whose character has been corrupted (plural "fāsiqūn").
words.name: Fāsiq (فاسق)

words.def: the short, opening sura of the Qur'an, which begins "In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds..." These words hold an important place in Muslim liturgies and forms the core of the salat.
words.name: Fātiḥa (الفاتحة)

words.def: legal opinion of an (alim) binding on him and on those who follow his taqlid
words.name: Fatwā (فتوى)

words.def: "In the protection of God". Said when a person departs.
words.name: Fī ʾAmān allāh (في أمان الله)

words.def: jurisprudence built around the shariah by custom (al-urf). Literally means "deep understanding", refers to understanding the Islamic laws. (see faqih)
words.name: Fiqh (فقه)

words.def: for the sake of Allah; common Islamic expression for performing acts such as charity or Jihad and for 'qatlu' (fighting in mortal combat for the sake of Allah)
words.name: Fī sabīl allāh (في سبيل الله)

words.def: trial or tribulation; also refers to any period of disorder, such as a civil war, or the period of time before the end of the world or any civil strife.
words.name: Fitna (pl. fitan) (فتنة)

words.def: innate disposition towards virtue, knowledge, and beauty. Muslims believe every child is born with fitrah.
words.name: Fiṭrah (فطرة)

words.def: the criterion (of right and wrong, true and false); for example, the Qur'an as furqan.
words.name: Furqān (فرقان)

words.def: vermin, evil from the root fasaqa meaning to deviate from the right way
words.name: Fuwaysiqah (فويسقة)

words.def: (verb in past tense) to forgive, to cover up (sins). A characteristic of God.
words.name: Ghafara (غفر)

words.def: heedlessness, forgetfulness of God, indifference
words.name: Ghaflah (غفلة)

words.def: the unseen, unknown.
words.name: Ghayb (غيب)

words.def: spoils of war, booty.
words.name: Ghanīmah (غنيمة)

words.def: excessive uncertainty;[4] also "the sale of what is not present" such as fish not yet caught, crops not yet harvested.[5]
words.name: Gharar (غرر)

words.def: possessed unlawfully
words.name: Ghasbi (غصب)

words.def: (archaic) roughly, "raider": a holy warrior; a mujahid
words.name: Ghāzi (غازى)

words.def: full ablution of the whole body (see wudu). Ghusl janaba is the mandatory shower after having sexual discharge.
words.name: Ghusl (غسل)

words.def: major ritual impurity which requires Niyyat for cleaning.
words.name: Ḥadath akbar (حدث أكبر)

words.def: minor ritual impurity
words.name: Ḥadath aṣghar (حدث أصغر)

words.def: Qur'anic expression and phrase meaning This is by the Grace of my Lord.
words.name: Hādhā min faḍl rabbī (هَذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّي)

words.def: a guide, one who guides; A Muslim name for God is The Guide, or Al-Hadi.
words.name: Hādī (هادي)

words.def: literally "speech"; recorded saying or tradition of the Prophet Muhammad validated by isnad; with sira these comprise the sunnah and reveal shariah
words.name: Ḥadīth (حديث ḥadīth) plural ahādīth

words.def: Well-known hadith; a hadith which reported by one, two, or more Companions from the Prophets or from another Companion, but has later become well-known and transmitted by an indefinite number of people during the first and second generation of Muslims.
words.name: Ḥadīth mashhūr (حديث مشهور)

words.def: someone who knows the Qur'an by heart. Literal translation = memorizer or Protector.
words.name: Ḥāfiẓ (حافظ)

words.def: menstruation
words.name: Haid|Ḥaiḍ (حيض)

words.def: Pilgrim, one who has made the Hajj.
words.name: Ḥājj (حاجّ) plural Ḥujjāj (حجّاج) and Ḥajīj (حجيج)

words.def: pilgrimage to Mecca. Sunnis regard this as the fifth Pillar of Islam. See Dhu al-Hijjah.
words.name: Ḥajj (حجّ) and Ḥijjah (plurals Ḥijjāt (حجّات) and Ḥijaj (حجج))

words.def: performing ʿUmrah during the Hajj season, and on the Day of Tarwiah a pilgrim gets into the state of Ihram for Hajj. Before making ʿUmrah, approach the Miqat and declare the intention. End by sacrificing an animal.
words.name: Ḥajj at-Tamattuʿ (حج التمتع)

words.def: At Miqat, declare intention to perform both Hajj and 'Umrah together. After throwing the Jamrah of Al-'Aqabah, and getting hair shaved or cut that take off his Ihram garments and sacrifice animal.
words.name: Ḥajj al-Qirān (حج القران)

words.def: At Miqat, declare intention for Hajj only. Maintain Ihram garments up to the Day of Sacrifice. No offering is required from him.
words.name: Ḥajj al-ʾIfrād (حج الإفراد)

words.def: a ruler's or governor's title; in some Muslim states, a judge. See Ahkam.
words.name: Ḥākim (حاكم)

words.def: sovereignty, governance.
words.name: Ḥākimīya (حاكمية)

words.def: lawful, permitted, good, beneficial, praiseworthy, honourable. (See mustahabb, mandub)
words.name: Ḥalāl (حلال)

words.def: A gathering or meeting for the primary purpose of learning about Islam.
words.name: Ḥalaqah (حلقة)

words.def: Shaving of the head, particularly associated with pilgrimage to Mecca[6]
words.name: Ḥalq (حلق)

words.def: pre-Islamic non-Jewish or non-Christian monotheists. Plural: ḥunafā' (حنفاء).
words.name: Ḥanīf (حنيف)

words.def: truth, reality, right, righteousness. Al-Haqq is one of 99 names of God.
words.name: Ḥaqq (حقّ)

words.def: sinful
words.name: Ḥarām (حرام)

words.def: sanctuary.
words.name: Ḥaram (حرم)

words.def: Good, beautiful, admirable. Also a categorization of a hadith's authenticity as "acceptable". (other categorizations include authentic and fabricated).
words.name: Ḥasan (حسن)

words.def: Vain or egotistical desire; individual passion; impulsiveness.
words.name: Hawa (هوى) (pl. ʾahwāʾ (أهواء))

words.def: guidance from God.
words.name: Hidāyah (هداية)

words.def: literally "cover". It describes the covering of the body for the purposes of modesty and dignity; broadly, a prescribed system of attitudes and behaviour regarding modesty and dignity. (See abayah, al-amira, burqa, chador, jilbab, khimar, milfeh, niqab, purdah, shayla)
words.name: Ḥijāb (حجاب)

words.def: Muhammad and his followers' emigration from Mecca to Medina. Literally, "migration". This holiday marks the beginning of the Muslim New Year on the first day of the month of Muharram. See Rabi' al-awwal and abbreviation AH.
words.name: Hijra (الهجرة)

words.def: Literally this means "wisdom" and refers to the highest possible level of understanding attainable by a Muslim. In particular, it refers to the illuminative, mystical sort of wisdom that a Gnostic or Sufi might attain.
words.name: Ḥikmah (حكمة)

words.def: Crescent moon.
words.name: Hilāl (هلال)

words.def: wilderness reserve, protected forest, grazing commons; a concept of stewardship
words.name: Ḥima (حمى)

words.def: One half of a juz', or roughly 1/60th of the Qur'an
words.name: Ḥizb (حزب)

words.def: Guidance.
words.name: Hudā (هدى)

words.def: Truce. Cease-fire (often temporary)
words.name: Hudna (هدنة)

words.def: Literally, limits or boundaries. Usually refers to limits placed by Allah on man; penalties of the Islamic law (sharia) for particular crimes described in the Qur'an – intoxication, theft, rebellion, adultery and fornication, false accusation of adultery, and apostasy. (See ta'zeer)
words.name: Ḥudūd (حدود) (sing. hadd)

words.def: ruling in the Qur'an or Sunnah. Also spelled Hukum.
words.name: Ḥukm (حكم)

words.def: beautiful and pure young men and women that Muslims believe inhabit Paradise, or Heaven.
words.name: Ḥūrī (حورية ḥūrīya; pl. ḥūrīyāt حوريات)

words.def: submission, worship, but not limited to ritual: all expressions of servitude to Allah, including the pursuit of knowledge, living a pious life, helping, charity, and humility, can be considered ibadah.
words.name: ʿIbādah (عبادة)

words.def: a jinn banished to Hell for his arrogance and disobedience; aka Satan : He is the equivalent of Lucifer.
words.name: ʾIblīs (إبليس)

words.def: festival or celebration. Alternatively transliterated Eid.
words.name: ʿId (عيد)

words.def: "the Festival of Sacrifice." The four-day celebration starting on the tenth day of Dhul-Hijja.
words.name: ʿId ul-Adha (عيد الأضحى)

words.def: "the Festival of Fitr (Breaking the fast)." A religious festival that marks the end of the fast of Ramadan.
words.name: ʿId ul-Fitr (عيد الفطر)

words.def: a meal eaten by Muslims breaking their fast after sunset during the month of Ramadan.
words.name: ʾIfṭār (إفطار)

words.def: state of consecration for hajj. Includes dress and or prayer.
words.name: ʾIḥrām (إحرام)

words.def: perfection in worship, such that Muslims try to worship God as if they see Him, and although they cannot see Him, they undoubtedly believe He is constantly watching over them.
words.name: ʾIḥsān (إحسان)

words.def: Also Ahwat. A Precaution, either obligatory or optional.[7]
words.name: ʾIḥtiyāṭ (إحتياط)

words.def: A preferred precaution.[7]
words.name: ʾIḥtiyāṭ mustaḥabb(إحتياط مستحبّ)

words.def: An obligatory precaution.[7]
words.name: ʾIḥtiyāṭ wājib(إحتياط واجب)

words.def: miracle, the character of the Qur'an in both form and content.
words.name: ʾIʿjāz (إعجاز)

words.def: a certificate authorizing one to transmit a subject or text of Islamic knowledge
words.name: ʾIjāzah (إجازة)

words.def: the consensus of either the ummah (or just the ulema) – one of four bases of Islamic Law. More generally, political consensus itself. Shi'a substitute obedience to the Imam; opposite of ikhtilaf
words.name: ʾIjmā' (إجماع)

words.def: During the early times of Islam, the possibility of finding a new solution to a juridical problem. Has not been allowed in conservative Islam since the Middle Ages. However, Liberal movements within Islam generally argue that any Muslim can perform ijtihad, given that Islam has no generally accepted clerical hierarchy or bureaucratic organization. The opposite of ijtihad is taqlid (تقليد), Arabic for "imitation".
words.name: ʾIjtihād (اجتهاد)

words.def: disagreement among the madhhabs (scholars) of a religious principle; opposite of ijma.
words.name: ʾIkhtilāf (اختلاف)

words.def: honouring, hospitality, generosity – Dhul jalaali wal ikraam is one of the 99 names of Allah.
words.name: ʾIkrām (إكرام)

words.def: mental or physical force.
words.name: ʾIkrāh (إكراه)

words.def: deity, a god; including gods worshiped by polytheists.
words.name: ʾIlāh (إله)

words.def: all varieties of knowledge, usually a synonym for science
words.name: ʿIlm (علم)

words.def: literally, leader; e.g. a man who leads a community or leads the prayer; the Shi'a sect use the term only as a title for one of the twelve Allah-appointed successors of Prophet Muhammad.
words.name: ʾImām (إمام)

words.def: successorship of Prophet Muhammad and the leadership of mankind.
words.name: ʾImāmah (إمامة) or imamate

words.def: personal faith
words.name: ʾImān (إيمان)

words.def: To Allah we belong and to Him is our return – said to mourners
words.name: ʾInna lilāhi wa ʾinna ʾilaihi rājiʿūn (إِنَّا لِلّهِ وَإِنَّـا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعونَ)

words.def: the habitual inclination to give rather than take in life; the basis for charity
words.name: ʾInfāq (إنفاق)

words.def: Arabic term for the holy book called The Gospel said to have been given to Jesus, who is known as Isa in Arabic; Muslims believe the holy book has been lost and the New Testament gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John) are not the word of Allah, only Christian stories about Jesus.
words.name: ʾInjīl (الإنجيل)

words.def: "If God wills"; Inshallah is "resigned, accepting, neutral, passive. It is neither optimistic nor pessimistic."[1] [2]
words.name: ʾIn shāʾa -llāh (إن شاء الله)

words.def: the second call to prayer. Similar to the azhan.
words.name: ʾIqāmah (إقامة)

words.def: apostasy (see murtadd). Also riddah ردة
words.name: ʾIrtidād (ارتداد)

words.def: Jesus – 'Isa ibn Maryam (English: Jesus son of Mary), (a matronymic since he had no biological father). The Qur'an asserts that Allah has no sons and therefore, 'Isa is not the son of Allah. Muslims honor 'Isa as a nabi and rasul.
words.name: ʿĪsā (عيسى)

words.def: night; the fifth salat prayer
words.name: ʿIshā' (عشاء)

words.def: "reform". This term may mean very different things, depending on the context. When used in reference to reform of Islam, it may mean modernism, such as that proposed by Muhammad Abduh; or Salafi literalism, such as that preached by Muhammad Nasiruddin al-Albani[8]
words.name: ʾIṣlāḥ (إصلاح )

words.def: "submission to God". The Arabic root word for Islam means submission, obedience, peace, and purity.
words.name: ʾIslām  (الإسلام)  (help·info)

words.def: chain of transmitters of any given hadith
words.name: ʾIsnād (إسناد)

words.def: the night journey during which Muhammad (محمّد)is said to have visited Heaven. See miraj.
words.name: ʾIsrāʾ (الإسراء)

words.def: requesting forgiveness
words.name: ʾIstighfār (استغفار)

words.def: vaginal bleeding except Haid and Nifas
words.name: ʾIstiḥādah (استحاضة)

words.def: public interest – a source of Islamic Law.
words.name: ʾIstiṣlāḥ (استصلاح)

words.def: martyrdom.
words.name: ʾIstishhād (استشهاد)

words.def: Negative reward for bad deeds that is tallied on qiyamah(judgment day.) Opposite of thawab.
words.name: ʾIthm (إثم)

words.def: seclusion in the masjid for the purpose of worship usually performed during the last 10 days of Ramadan.
words.name: ʾIʿtikāf (إعتكاف)

words.def: clarification of truth in its ultimate form.
words.name: ʾItmām al-hujjah (إتمام الحجة)

words.def: command to fear God or to be pious to Allah.
words.name: Ittaqullah (اتقوا الله)

words.def: That which is allowed or permissible. As a rule, everything that is not prohibited is allowed. (See halal, mustahabb, mandub)
words.name: Jāʾiz (جائز)

words.def: the Hell-fire; Hell
words.name: Jahannam (جهنم)

words.def: the time of ignorance before Islam was realized. Describes polytheistic religions.
words.name: Jāhilīyyah (الجاهليّة)

words.def: ignorance, foolishness.
words.name: Jahl (جهل)

words.def: "gathering"; i.e. a university, a mosque, or more generally, a community or association.
words.name: Jāmiʿah (جامعة)

words.def: A state of spiritual impurity that occur due to sexual intercourse or ejaculation and necessitates major ritual ablution (ghusl),
words.name: Janābah(جنابة )

words.def: Funeral. Ṣalāt al-Janāzah is a funeral prayer.
words.name: Janāzah (جنازة)

words.def: Paradise, Heaven, the Garden
words.name: Jannah (جنة)

words.def: "May God reward you with good." Islamic expression of gratitude.
words.name: Jazāka-llāhu khayran (جزاك اللهُ خيرًا)

words.def: struggle. Any earnest striving in the way of God, involving personal, physical, for righteousness and against wrongdoing;
words.name: Jihād (جهاد)

words.def: Offensive jihad declared by caliph.
words.name: Jihād aṣ-ṣaghīr (جهاد الصغير)

words.def: Offensive jihad.
words.name: Jihād aṭ-ṭalab (جهاد الطلب)

words.def: Defensive jihad.
words.name: Jihād ad-dafʿa (جهاد الدفعة)

words.def: Financial jihad.
words.name: Jihād bil-māl (جهاد بامال)

words.def: literally 'struggle by the sword'; holy war.
words.name: Jihād bis-saif ( جهاد بالسيف)

words.def: (pl. jalabib) a long, flowing, garment worn by some as a more conservative means of fulfillment of sartorial hijab. (See also: abaya. burka, chador)
words.name: Jilbāb (جلباب)

words.def: An invisible being of fire
words.name: Jinn (جنّ)

words.def: A tax specified in the Koran (9:29) to be paid by non-Muslim males living under Muslim political control.
words.name: Jizya (جزية)

words.def: To deny. Jaahid (the denier). Disbelief out of rejection. When there comes to them that which they [should] have recognized, they refuse to believe in (kafaru) it. ( 2:89) Accordingly, juhud includes rejection (kufr at-taktheeb) and resistance (kufr al-'inaad)
words.name: Juhud

words.def: Friday prayer
words.name: Jumuʿah (جمعة)

words.def: an unclean state of body as in breaking Wudu
words.name: Junub (جنب)

words.def: one of thirty parts of the Qur'an
words.name: Juzʾ (جزء)

words.def: cube-house; the cube-shaped building, i.e., in Mecca toward which Muslims pray.
words.name: Kaʿbah (الكعبة)

words.def: from the word kafara, "to hide." Those who deliberately hide the truth; non-muslims in non-islamic countries or states, unbelievers, truth-concealers; one who is ungrateful. Common degoratory term used by different islamic factions such as sunni and shias to denounce each other as non-muslims. Plural: Kāfirūn. Commonly used as an offensive term for black people by white South Africans.
words.name: Kāfir (كافر kāfir sing.; كفّار kuffār pl.)

words.def: Literally, "words" or "speech," and referring to oration. The name applied to the discipline of philosophy and theology concerned specifically with the nature of faith, determinism and freedom, and the nature of the divine attributes.
words.name: Kalām (علم الكلام) (ʿilm al-kalām)

words.def: Every kind of good
words.name: Khair (خير)

words.def: Caliph, more generally, one performing the duties of khilafa.
words.name: Khalīfah (خليفة)

words.def: devoted friend
words.name: Khalīl (خليل)

words.def: Creation – the act of measuring; determining, estimating and calculating. Khalq is the noun form of the verb khalaqa (see bara, sawwara).
words.name: Khalq (خلق)

words.def: The Creator, Allah.
words.name: Al-khāliq (الخالق)

words.def: Intoxicant, wine.
words.name: Khamr (خمر)

words.def: the speaker at the Friday Muslim prayer, or Jumu'ah prayer.
words.name: Khatīb (خطيب)

words.def: Complete recitation of the Qur'an.
words.name: Khatm (ختم)

words.def: a land tax.
words.name: Kharāj (خراج)

words.def: goodness. See birr (righteousness) See qist (equity) See 'adl (equilibrium and justice) See haqq (truth and right) See ma'ruf (known and approved) See taqwa (piety.)
words.name: Khayr

words.def: Controversy, dispute, discord.
words.name: khilāf (خلاف)

words.def: Man's trusteeship and stewardship of Earth; Most basic theory of the Caliphate; Flora and fauna as sacred trust; Accountability to; God for harms to nature, failure to actively care and maintain. Three specific ways in which khalifa is manifested in Muslim practice are the creation of haram to protect water, hima to protect other species (including those useful to man), and by resisting infidel domination over Muslim lands, in jihad.
words.name: Khilāfah (خلافة)

words.def: four first caliphs, believed by most Muslims to be most righteous rulers in history
words.name: al-khulafāʾ ar-rāshidūn (الخلفاء الراشدون)

words.def: headcovering (Q. 24:31).
words.name: Khimār (خمار) (pl. khumur (خُمُر) or ʾakhmirah (أخْمِرة))

words.def: Male circumcision.
words.name: Khitān (ختان)

words.def: ethics
words.name: Khuluq (خُلُق) pl. ʾakhlāq (أخلاق)

words.def: humility, devotion, concentration (especially in prayer).
words.name: Khushūʿ (خشوع)

words.def: the sermon at Jumu'ah prayer.
words.name: Khuṭbah (خطبة)

words.def: pride, arrogance
words.name: Kibr (كِبْر)

words.def: old age
words.name: Kibar (كِبَر)

words.def: book; The Qurʾān is often referred to as "Al-Kitāb" (The Book).
words.name: Kitāb (كتاب)

words.def: Unbelief, infidelity, blasphemy; also hubris. See Kafir and Kuffar
words.name: Kufr (كفر)

words.def: Disbelief from judgment.
words.name: Kufr al-ḥukm (كفر الحكم)

words.def: Disbelief out of stubbornness
words.name: Kufr al-ʿInād (كفر العناد)

words.def: Disbelief out of arrogance and pride.
words.name: Kufr al-ʾInkār (كفر الإنكار)

words.def: Disbelief because of trying to substitute Allaah's Laws.
words.name: Kufr al-ʾIstibdāl (كفر الإستبدال)

words.def: Disbelief out of trying to make HARAM into HALAL.
words.name: Kufr al-ʾIstiḥlāl (كفر الإستحلال)

words.def: Disbelief due to mockery and derision
words.name: Kufrul-Istihzaha

words.def: Disbelief from not being aware of or not understanding.
words.name: Kufr al-jahl (كفر الجهل)

words.def: Disbelief from obstinacy after being presented with truth.
words.name: Kufr al-juhud (كفر الجهد)

words.def: Disbelief out of hypocrisy.
words.name: Kufr an-Nifāq (كفر النفاق)

words.def: Disbelief due to avoidance.
words.name: Kufr al-ʾIʿrāḍ (كفر الإعراض)

words.def: God's command to the universe, 'Be!' is sufficient to create it.
words.name: Kun (كن)

words.def: "There is no god but God." The most important expression in Islam. It is part of the first pillar of Islam. According to Islam, this is the message of all the Prophets, such as Abraham, Moses, Jesus and Muhammad.
words.name: Lā ilāha illā-llāh (لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا الله)

words.def: God, I obey you (said during hajj)
words.name: Labbayka -llāhumma (لبّيكَ اللّهُم)

words.def: Dirty, false, evil vain talk
words.name: Laghw (لغو)

words.def: Curse, execration, or imprecation.
words.name: Laʿnah (لعنة)

words.def: the Night of Power, towards the end of Ramadan, when Muhammad received the first revelation of the Qur'an.
words.name: Laylat al-Qadr (ليلة القدر)

words.def: school, university
words.name: Madrasah (مدرسة)

words.def: the fourth daily salat prayer
words.name: Maghrib (مغرب)

words.def: "a guide". More specifically al-Mahdi (the guide) is a figure who will appear with Prophet Jesus before the end of time, when God allows it, to bring world peace, order and justice, after it has been overcome with injustice and aggression.
words.name: Mahdi (مهدي)

words.def: he whose blood must be wasted
words.name: Mahdūr ad-damm (مهدور الدم)

words.def: a relative of the opposite gender usually described as being "within the forbidden limits"; a better description is "within the protected limits". means relatives who one can appear before without observing hijab and who one cannot marry.
words.name: Maḥram (محرم)

words.def: gambling, game of chance
words.name: Maisir (ميسر )

words.def: Means "detested", though not haraam (forbidden); something that is disliked or offensive. If a person commits the Makruh, he does not accumulate ithim but avoiding the Makhruh is rewarded with thawab.
words.name: Makrūh (مكروه)

words.def: angels (Sing. Malak). It was one of these mala'ika, Jibril (Gabriel) who delivered Allah's revelation to Muhammad.
words.name: Malāʾikah (ملائكة)

words.def: one's rightful spouse (literally: what your right hands possess)
words.name: Mā malakat ʾaymānukum (ما ملكت أيمانكم)

words.def: the rules specifying the requirements of a legally valid hajj
words.name: Manāsik (مناسك)

words.def: commendable or recommended. Failure to do it would not be a sin. (See halal mustahabb)
words.name: Mandūb (مندوب)

words.def: the methodology by which truth is reached[9]
words.name: Manhaj (منهج)

words.def: That which is abrogated. The doctrine of al-Nasikh wal-Mansukh (abrogation) of certain parts of the Qur'anic revelation by others. The principle is mentioned in the Qur'an (2:106) see naskh
words.name: Mansūkh (منسوخ)

words.def: one of seven equal parts of the Qur'an
words.name: Manzil (منزل)

words.def: consensus of the community
words.name: Maʿrūf (معروف)

words.def: goals or purposes; such as the purposes of Islamic law
words.name: Maqāṣid (مقاصد) sing. maqṣid (مقصد)

words.def: public interests
words.name: Maṣāliḥ (مصالح) sing. maṣlaḥah (مصلحة)

words.def: Allah has willed it
words.name: Mā shāʾa -llāh (ما شاء الله)

words.def: the (Biblical) Messiah, Jesus Christ
words.name: Masīḥ (مسيح)

words.def: place of prayer; mosque
words.name: Masjid (مسجد) pl. masājid, مساجد

words.def: the mosque surrounding the Kaʿbah in Mecca.
words.name: Masjid al-Ḥarām (المسجد الحرام)

words.def: pl. Madhāhib (مذاهب) school of religious jurisprudence, school of thought;Mawali or mawala (موالي): Non-Arab Muslims
words.name: Madhhab (مذهب)

words.def: protector or master
words.name: Mawlā [mawlan (مولى)] [pl. mawālin (موالٍ)]

words.def: an Arabic word literally meaning "our lord" or "our master". It is used mostly as a title preceding the name of a respected religious leader, in particular graduates of religious institutions. The term is sometimes used to refer to Rumi.
words.name: Mawlānā (مولانا)

words.def: an honorific Islamic religious title often, but not exclusively, given to Muslim religious scholars or Ulema preceding their names. Maulvi generally means any religious cleric or teacher
words.name: Maulvi (مولوی)

words.def: the holiest city in Islam
words.name: Mecca (مكّة Makkah)

words.def: "city"; Medinat-un-Nabi means "the City of the Prophet." See Hijra (Islam)
words.name: Medina (مدينة Madīnah)

words.def: the Resurrection; God will resurrect all of humankind to be judged. Shi'as regard this as the fifth Pillar of Islam.
words.name: Mi'ād (معاد)

words.def: a niche in the wall of all mosques, indicating the direction of prayer
words.name: Miḥrāb (محراب)

words.def: In Arabic, millah means "religion," but it has only been used to refer to religions other than Islam, which is din.
words.name: Millah (مِلَّة)

words.def: (see Millah) (Turkish word also meaning a nation, community, or a people). In an Islamic state, "Ahl al Kitab" may continue to practice their former religion in a semi-autonomous community termed the millet.
words.name: Millet

words.def: a tower built onto a mosque from the top of which the call to prayer is made
words.name: Minaret (منارة)

words.def: a raised pulpit in the mosque where the Imam stands to deliver sermons
words.name: Minbar (منبر)

words.def: methodology, e.g. methods, rules, system, procedures.
words.name: Minhaj (منهج)

words.def: intended place
words.name: Mīqāt (ميقات )

words.def: the Ascension to the Seven Heavens during the Night Journey See also: isra
words.name: Miʿrāj (المعراج)

words.def: a person who performs the call to prayer
words.name: Muʾadhdhin (مأذن)

words.def: treaties
words.name: Muʿāhadāt (معاهدات)

words.def: suras Al-Falaq and an-Nas, the "Surahs of refuge", should be said to relieve suffering (also protect from Black Magic)
words.name: Muʿawwidhatayn (المعوذتين)

words.def: literally permissible; neither forbidden nor commended. Neutral. (See halal)
words.name: Mubāḥ (مباح)

words.def: person who recites Qur'an
words.name: Mubaligh (مبلغ)

words.def: an Islamic scholar who is an interpreter or expounder of Islamic law (Sharia), capable of issuing fataawa (plural of "fatwa").
words.name: Muftī (مفتى)

words.def: woman who wears hijab (polite form of hijabi).
words.name: Muḥajabah (محجبة)

words.def: unequivocal verses of Qur'an. (See mutashabehat.)
words.name: Muhakkamat

words.def: a person who wages war against God
words.name: Muḥāribah (محاربة)

words.def: "Muhammad is the messenger of God." This statement is the second part of the first pillar of Islam. This is the second most important statement in Islam.
words.name: Muḥammadun rasūl allāh (محمدٌ رسول الله)

words.def: evil-doer a person who wages jihad (war) not in accordance with the Qur'an. Plural mufsideen.
words.name: Mufsid (مفسد)

words.def: a person who performs good deed. Plural muhsineen. Opposite of Mufsidun.
words.name: Muḥsin (محسن)

words.def: The first Muslims that accompanied Muhammad when he traveled to Medina.
words.name: Muhājirūn (مهاجرون)

words.def: heretic.
words.name: Muharṭiq (مهرطق)

words.def: a fighter for Islam. Plural Mujāhidūn (مجاهدون).
words.name: Mujāhid (مجاهد)

words.def: a scholar who uses reason for the purpose of forming an opinion or making a ruling on a religious issue. Plural: Mujtahidun.
words.name: Mujtahid (مجتهد)

words.def: are Islamic clergy. Ideally, they should have studied the Qur'an, Islamic traditions (hadith), and Islamic law (fiqh).
words.name: Mullah (ملا)

words.def: A Muslim who observes the commandments of the Qur'an.
words.name: Muʾmin (مؤمن)

words.def: hypocrite. Plural: Munafiqun
words.name: Munāfiq (منافق)

words.def: woman who wears niqab
words.name: Muntaqabah (منتقبة) pl. muntaqabāt (منتقبات)

words.def: a type of sharia-compliant mortgage (see Ijara)
words.name: Murābaḥah ( مرابحة)

words.def: a Sufi teacher
words.name: Murshid (مرشد)

words.def: apostate (see irtidad see mahdur ad-damm.)
words.name: Murtadd (مرتد) female apostate is Murtaddah

words.def: a copy, codex or redaction of the Qur'an.
words.name: Muṣḥaf (مصحف)

words.def: One who associates others in worship with God; a polytheist.
words.name: Mushrik (مشرك)(pl. mushrikūn) (مشركون)

words.def: a follower of the religion of Islam. One who submits their will to Allah (God)
words.name: Muslim (مسلم)

words.def: commendable or recommended. (See halal, mandub)
words.name: Mustaḥabb (مستحبّ)

words.def: literally enjoyment; compensation paid to a divorced woman; when used in the phrase nikāḥ al-mutʿah (نكاح المتعة) it refers to temporary marriage.
words.name: Mutʿah (متعة)

words.def: equivocal verses of Qur'an. (See Muhakkamat.)
words.name: Mutashābihāt (متشابهات)

words.def: fanatics
words.name: Mutaʿaṣṣibūn (متعصّبون)

words.def: religious man in certain regions, a volunteer teacher
words.name: Muṭawwaʿ (مطوّع) plural muṭawwaʿūn (مطوّعون)

words.def: Religious police.
words.name: Muṭawwaʿūn (مطوّعون) (مطوعين) (singular muṭawwaʿ)

words.def: "agreed upon"—used to describe hadith that were narrated by many witnesses through different narration chains (isnads) leading back to Muhammad
words.name: Mutawātir (متواتر)

words.def: literally, prophets. In the Islamic context, a Nabi is a man sent by God to give guidance to man, but not given scripture. The Prophet Abraham was a Nabi. This is in contrast to Rasul, or Messenger. Plural: Anbiya. See: Rasul.
words.name: Nabī (نبي)

words.def: soul, the lower self, the ego/id
words.name: Nafs (النفس)

words.def: An optional, supererogatory practice of worship, in contrast to farida
words.name: Nāfilah (نافلة)

words.def: Impurity
words.name: Najāsah (نجاسة)

words.def: impure
words.name: Nājis (ناجس)

words.def: two malaikah who test the faith of the dead in their graves
words.name: Nakīr and Munkar (نكير و منكر)

words.def: advice
words.name: Naṣīḥa (نصيحة)

words.def: The doctrine of al-Nasikh wal-Mansukh (abrogation) of certain parts of the Qur'anic revelation by others. The principle is mentioned in the Qur'an (2:106) see mansukh.
words.name: Naskh (نسخ)

words.def: a known, clear legal injunction
words.name: Naṣṣ (نصّ)

words.def: the bleeding after childbirth (see Haid)
words.name: Nifās (نفاس)

words.def: falsehood; dishonesty; hypocrisy
words.name: Nifāq (نفاق)

words.def: the matrimonial contract between a bride and bridegroom within Islamic marriage
words.name: Nikāḥ (النكاح)

words.def: veil covering the face
words.name: Niqāb (نقاب)

words.def: intention
words.name: Niyyah (نية)

words.def: prophethood. Shi'as regard this as the third Pillar of Islam.
words.name: Nubūwwah (نبوّة)

words.def: a great munkar – prohibited, evil, dreadful thing.
words.name: Nukrah

words.def: light. Muslims believe angels were created from light and jinn from fire.
words.name: Nūr (نور)

words.def: an acronym that stands for "peace be upon him" a blessing which is affixed to Muhammad's name whenever it is written. In some circles and English writings, Sufis regard PBUH to signify "Peace and Blessings Upon Him" (the Rasul or Messenger of Allah). These are the primary English explications of the P.B.U.H. acronym. The Arabic version is S.A.W.
words.name: P.B.U.H.

words.def: false imputation of unchastity specifically punished by sharia.
words.name: Qadhf (قذف)

words.def: predestination.
words.name: Qadar (قدر)

words.def: judge of Islamic Law
words.name: Qāḍī (قاضي)

words.def: Heart
words.name: Qalb (قلب)

words.def: the direction Muslims face during prayer
words.name: Qiblah (قبلة)

words.def: fight in the cause of Allah.
words.name: Qitāl fī sabīl allāh ( قتال في سبيل الله )

words.def: resurrection; return of the dead for the Day of Judgment
words.name: Qiyāmah (قيامة)

words.def: equitable retribution – a fine for murder if the heirs forgive the perpetrator. (See hudud, tazeer)
words.name: Qiṣāṣ (قصاص)

words.def: to stand, a position of salat prayer
words.name: Qiyām (قيام)

words.def: analogy – foundation of legal reasoning and thus fiqh
words.name: Qiyās (القياس)

words.def: classification of a hadith that are believed to be narrated by Muhammad from God.
words.name: Qudsī (قدسي)

words.def: closeness to God. Term is associated with Sufism.
words.name: Qurbah (قربة)

words.def: The word Qur'an means recitation. Muslims believe the Qur'an (Koran) to be the literal word of God and the culmination of God's revelation to mankind, revealed to prophet Muhammad in the year AD 610 in the cave Hira by the angel Jibril.
words.name: Qurʾān (القرآن)

words.def: Lord, Sustainer, Cherisher, Master.
words.name: Rabb (ربّ)

words.def: May Allah be pleased with him. Variants are ʿanhā (her) and ʿanhum (them).
words.name: R. A., raḍiya -llāhu ʿanhu (رضي الله عنه)

words.def: Merciful; Ar-Rahman (الرحمن) means "The Most Merciful"
words.name: Raḥmān (رحمن)

words.def: compassionate; Ar-Rahim (الرحيم) means "The Most Compassionate" as in the Basmala
words.name: Raḥīm (رحيم)

words.def: May Allah have mercy on him. Usually used after mentioning the companions of Muhammad
words.name: Raḥimaḥullāh (رحمه الله)

words.def: Mercy of Allah. Sometimes used as an alternative to Rahimahullah after mentioning a righteous person by saying, rahmatullahi ʿilayh (رحمة الله علیه): Mercy of Allah be upon him/her
words.name: Raḥmatullāh (رحمة الله)

words.def: the practice of stoning
words.name: Rajm (رجم)

words.def: one unit of Islamic prayer, or Salat. Each daily prayer is made up of a different number of raka'ah.
words.name: Rakʿah (ركعة)

words.def: month of fasting when the Qur'an was first revealed
words.name: Ramaḍān (رمضان)

words.def: Sunnis consider the first four caliphs as the "orthodox" or "rightly guided" caliphs. They were Abu Bakr, 'Umar, 'Uthman and 'Ali.
words.name: Rāshidūn (راشدون)

words.def: messenger; Unlike prophets (Nabi), messengers are given scripture. Moses (as), David (as), Jesus (as) and Mohammed (as) are considered messengers. All messengers are considered prophets, but not all prophets are given scripture. See: Nabi.
words.name: Rasūl (رسول)

words.def: interest, the charging and paying of which is forbidden by the Qur'an
words.name: Riba (ربا)

words.def: Guarding Muslims from infidels
words.name: Ribat

words.def: apostasy, in which a person abandons Islam for another faith or no faith at all.
words.name: Riddah (ردة)

words.def: literally, message or letter. Used both in common parlance for mail correspondences, and in religious context as divine message.
words.name: Risālah (رِسَالَة)

words.def: spirit; the divine breath which God blew into the clay of Adam.
words.name: Rūḥ (روح)

words.def: means what is inevitable. One of the five pillars of Islam. (See fard, wajib)
words.name: Rukn (ركن) plural ʾArkān (أركان)

words.def: the bowing performed during salat.
words.name: Rukūʿ (ركوع)

words.def: blasphemy: insulting God (sabb Allah) or Muhammad (sabb ar-rasūl or sabb an-nabī).
words.name: Sabb (سَبّ)

words.def: patience, endurance, self-restraint
words.name: Ṣabr (صبر)

words.def: charity; voluntary alms above the amount for zakat.
words.name: Ṣadaqah (صدقة)

words.def: companions of Muhammad. A list of the best-known Companions can be found at List of companions of Muhammad.
words.name: Ṣaḥābah (الصحابة) (sing. Ṣāḥib) (صاحب)

words.def: "Sound in isnad." A technical attribute applied to the "isnad" of a hadith.
words.name: Ṣāḥīḥ (صحيح)

words.def: divine "tranquility" or "peace" which descends upon a person when the Qur'an is recited.
words.name: Sakīnah (سكينة)

words.def: (righteous) predecessors/ancestors. In Islam, Salaf is generally used to refer to the first three generations of Muslims. Anyone who died after this is one of the khalaf or "latter-day Muslims".
words.name: Salaf (السلف الصالح)

words.def: any one of the daily five obligatory prayers. Sunnis regard this as the second Pillar of Islam
words.name: Ṣalāt (صلاة) sala(t)

words.def: Prayer for guidance is done in conjunction with two rakaahs of supererogatory prayer.
words.name: Salaat al-Istikharah

words.def: peace (see sulh)
words.name: Salām (سلام)

words.def: "May Allah bless him and grant him peace." The expression should be used after stating Prophet Muhammad's name. See abbreviation: S.A.W. or S.A.W.S. also P.B.U.H.
words.name: Sallallahu alayhi wa sallam (صلى الله عليه و سلم)

words.def: eternal, absolute; Muslims believe Allah is "The Eternal."
words.name: Ṣamad (صمد)

words.def: a river in heaven (al-firdaus)
words.name: Salsabīl (سلسبيل)

words.def: awakening, revival
words.name: Sawa

words.def: Sallallahu alayhi wa sallam (صلى الله عليه و سلم). See P.B.U.H.
words.name: S.A.W. (or S.A.W.S.)

words.def: fasting during the month of Ramadhan. The word sawm is derived from Syriac sawmo.
words.name: Ṣawm (صَوم)

words.def: (in everyday usage, equivalent to 'Mr.') a descendant of a relative of Muhammad, usually via Husayn.
words.name: Sayyid (سيّد)

words.def: refer to some of the ceremonies used by various sufi orders
words.name: Sema

words.def: The testimony of faith: La ilaha illa Allah. Muhammadun rasulullah. ("There is no god but Allah. Muhammad is the messenger of Allah."). Sunnis regard this as the first Pillar of Islam. Also may be used as a synonym for the term Istish'hād meaning martyrdom.
words.name: Shahādah (الشهادة)

words.def: witness, martyr. Usually refers to a person killed whilst fighting in "jihād fī sabīl Allāh" (jihad for the sake of Allah). Often used in modern times for deaths in a political cause (including victims of soldiers, deaths in battle, et cetera) which are viewed by some Muslims as a spiritual cause not just a political cause. But the real meaning of Jihad is to defend Islam in any way; thus, it could be in an economic way or could refer to fighting for the rights of the oppressed or the believers; most often it refers to mastering one's own inclination for evil and shirk.
words.name: Shahīd (شهيد) pl. shuhadāʾ (شهداء)

words.def: a spiritual master, Muslim clergy
words.name: Shaykh (شيخ)

words.def: "the path to a watering hole"; Islamic law; the eternal ethical code and moral code based on the Qur'an, Sunnah, Ijma, and Qiyas; basis of Islamic jurisprudence (fiqh)
words.name: Sharīʿah (الشريعة)

words.def: a title bestowed upon the descendants of Muhammad through Hasan, son of his daughter Fatima Zahra and son-in-law Ali ibn Abi Talib
words.name: Sharīf (شريف)

words.def: Satan, the Devil; also known as Iblis
words.name: Shayṭān (شيطان)

words.def: A branch of Islam who believe in Imam Ali and his sons (Hassan and Hussayn) as custodians of Islam by the will of the Prophet Mohammed.
words.name: Shīʿah (الشيعة)

words.def: idolatry; polytheism; the sin of believing in any divinity except God and of associating other gods with God.
words.name: Shirk (شرك)

words.def:
consultation

Majlis ash-shūrā (مجلس الشورى) 
advisory council in a Caliphate
words.name: Shūrā (شورى)

words.def: advisory council in a Caliphate
words.name: Majlis ash-shūrā (مجلس الشورى)

words.def: a lotus tree that marks the end of the seventh heaven, the boundary where no creation can pass.
words.name: Sidrat al-Muntaha (سدرة المنتهى )

words.def: life or biography of the Prophet Muhammad; his moral example – with hadith this comprises the sunnah
words.name: Sīrah (السيرة)

words.def: the Straight Path
words.name: aṣ-Ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm ( الصراط المستقيم)

words.def: true dawn
words.name: Subah Sadiq

words.def: expression used following written name or vocalization of Allah in Arabic meaning highly praised and glorified is He.
words.name: Subḥānahu wa taʿāla (سبحانه و تعالى)(abbreviated S.W.T.)

words.def: "Glory to God" – this phrase is often used when praising God or exclaiming awe at His attributes, bounties, or creation.
words.name: Subḥān allāh (سبحان الله)

words.def: a Muslim mystic; See: Sufism (tasawwuf).
words.name: Ṣūfī (صوفي)

words.def: the meal eaten by fasting Muslims just before dawn.
words.name: Suḥūr (سحور)

words.def: kneeling down, a position of salat.
words.name: Sujūd(سجود)

words.def: bond that generates revenue from sales, profits, or leases rather than interest.
words.name: Ṣukūk (صكوك)

words.def: A condition of peace, an armistice, or treaty. It is related to the word muṣālaḥah (مصالحة) which means peace, conciliation, or compromise.
words.name: Ṣulḥ (صلح)

words.def: the "path" or "example" of the Prophet Muhammad, i.e., what the Prophet did or said or agreed to during his life. He is considered by Muslims to be the best human moral example, the best man to follow.
words.name: Sunnah (السنّة) or sunnat an-Nabī (سنّة النبي)

words.def: the largest denomination of Islam. The word Sunni comes from the word Sunnah (Arabic: سنة), which means the words and actions or example of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.
words.name: Sunni (سنّي)

words.def: chapter; the Qur'an is composed of 114 suras
words.name: Sūrah (سورة)

words.def: Almighty
words.name: Taʿāla (تعالى)

words.def: followers of the Ṣaḥābah
words.name: Tābiʿīn (تابعون|تابعين)

words.def: exegesis, particularly such commentary on the Qur'an
words.name: Tafsīr (تفسير)

words.def: originally Aramaic, meaning "false god"; also tyranny.
words.name: Ṭāghūt (طاغوت) (taghout)

words.def: optional (supererogatory), late-night (pre-dawn) prayer
words.name: Tahajjud (تهجُّد)

words.def: purification from ritual impurities by means of wudu or ghusl
words.name: Ṭahārah (طهارة)

words.def: pure, ritually clean
words.name: Ṭāhir (طاهر)

words.def: Uttering the formula of faith: "Lā ilāha illā -llāh", (i.e. "There is no god but God")
words.name: Tahlīl (تهليل)

words.def: 'Tahnik' is an Islamic ceremony of touching the lips of a newborn baby with honey, sweet juice or pressed dates.
words.name: Taḥnīk (تحنيك)

words.def: corruption, forgery. Muslims believe the Bible Scriptures were corrupted but the Qur'an is in its original form.
words.name: Taḥrīf (تحريف)

words.def: to purify and reform society in order to move it toward greater equity and justice, literally meaning to make new in present tense
words.name: Tajdīd (تجديد)

words.def: blasphemy
words.name: Tajdīf (تجديف)

words.def: a special manner of reciting the Qur'an according to prescribed rules of pronunciation and intonation.
words.name: Tajwīd (تجويد)

words.def: Based on sharia Islamic law, it is a form of mutual insurance. See retakaful.
words.name: Takāful ( التكتاقل)

words.def: a proclamation of the greatness of Allah; a Muslim invocation.
words.name: Takbīr (تكبير)

words.def: declaration of individual or group of previously considered Muslim as kaffir.
words.name: Takfīr (تكفير)

words.def: The science of hadith extraction and authentication, including validation of chains of transmitters of a hadith by this science's scholars and grading hadith validity.
words.name: Takhrīj (تخريج الحديث )

words.def: Ontological
words.name: Takweeni (تکوینیة)

words.def: divorce
words.name: Ṭalāq (الطلاق)

words.def: fate, predestination
words.name: Taqdīr (تقدير)

words.def: to follow the scholarly opinion of one of the four Imams of Islamic Jurisprudence.
words.name: Taqlīd (تقليد)

words.def: 'precaution', that one is allowed to hide his true beliefs in certain circumstances or to lie to save himself of being killed or harmed.
words.name: Taqīyyah (تقيّة)

words.def: righteousness; goodness; Piety: Taqwa is taken from the verbe Ittaqua, which means Avoiding, Fearing the punishment from Allah for committing sins. It is piety obtained by fearing the punishment of Allah.
words.name: Taqwa (تقوى)

words.def: extra prayers in Ramadan after the Isha prayer.
words.name: Tarāwīḥ (تراويح)

words.def: the study of Arabic grammar issued from the Qur'an
words.name: Tarkīb (تَرْكِيب)

words.def: a Muslim religious order, particularly a Sufi order
words.name: Ṭarīqah (طريقة)

words.def: slow, meditative recitation of the Qur'an
words.name: Tartīl (ترتيل)

words.def: Uttering the formula: "Subhan Allah", i.e. (Glory be to Allah)
words.name: Tasbīḥ (تسبيح)

words.def: vocalization of Arabic text by means of diacritical marks. An integral part of the Arabic writing system. Literally meaning to form or arrange
words.name: Tashkīl (تشكيل)

words.def: salutation at the end of prayer
words.name: Taslīm (تسليم)

words.def: Shia Ashura ceremony of self-flagellation by hitting head with sword.
words.name: Taṭbīr (تطبير)

words.def: total reliance on Allah.
words.name: Tawakkul (توکل)

words.def: asking Allah Almighty through the medium and intercession of another person.
words.name: Tawassul (توسُّل)

words.def: circumambulating the Ka'bah during Hajj.
words.name: Ṭawāf (طواف)

words.def: Divine help in getting to the purpose to one who deserves.
words.name: Tawfiq (توفیق)

words.def: repentance
words.name: Tawbah (توبة)

words.def: monotheism; affirmation of the Oneness of Allah. Muslims regard this as the first part of the Pillar of Islam, the second part is accepting Muhammad as rasoul (messenger). The opposite of Tawheed is shirk
words.name: Tawḥīd (توحيد)

words.def: the Torah as revealed to Musa (Moses.)
words.name: Tawrāh (توراة)

words.def: all that is good as regards things, deeds, beliefs, persons, foods, etc. Means "pure." The Shahaddath is tayyib.
words.name: Ṭayyib (طيِّب)

words.def: Discretionary punishment – a sentence or punishment whose measure is not fixed by the Shari'ah. (See hudud, qisas)
words.name: Taʿzīr (تعزير)

words.def: Purification of the Soul.
words.name: Tazkīyah (تزكية)

words.def: Reward for good deeds that is tallied on qiyamah (judgment day.) Opposite of ithim.
words.name: Thawāb (ثواب)

words.def: ritual recitation of passages of the Qur'an.
words.name: Tilāwah (تلاوة)

words.def: state of motionlessness, calm
words.name: Ṭumaʾnīnah (طمأنينة)

words.def: worship
words.name: ʿUbūdīyah (عبودية)

words.def: sacrifice
words.name: ʾUḍḥīyah (أضحية)

words.def: the leaders of Islamic society, including teachers, Imams and judges. Singular alim.
words.name: ʿUlamāʾ (علماء) or ulema

words.def: (literally 'nation') the global community of all Muslim believers
words.name: ʾUmmah (الاُمّة) or umma

words.def: the lesser pilgrimage performed in Mecca. Unlike hajj, ʿumrah can be performed throughout the year.
words.name: ʿUmrah (عمرة)

words.def: the branch of sharia that deals with punishment. (See hudud, qisas, tazeer)
words.name: ʿUqūbah (عقوبة)

words.def: custom of a given society, leading to change in the fiqh
words.name: ʿUrf (عرف)

words.def: Principles, origins.
words.name: ʾUṣūl (أُصول) (sing. ʾaṣl)(أصل)

words.def: the study of the origins and practice of Islamic jurisprudence (fiqh)
words.name: ʾUṣūl al-Fiqh (أصول الفقه)

words.def: Wa 'Alaykum as-Salaam!, meaning "and upon you be peace". (see As-Salamu Alaykum)
words.name: Wa ʿalaykum as-salām (وعليكم السلام)

words.def: death. (Barah-wafat) Muhammad was born on the twelfth day of Rabi-ul-Awwal, the third month of the Muslim year. His death anniversary also falls on the same day, the word 'barah' standing for the twelve days of Muhammad's sickness.
words.name: Wafāt (وفاة)

words.def: "unity of being". Philosophical term used by some Sufis. Related to fanaa
words.name: Waḥdat al-wujūd (وحدة الوجود)

words.def: revelation or inspiration of God to His prophets for all humankind
words.name: Waḥy (وحی)

words.def: literal meaning is "weakness" or "feebleness". According to one hadith,[10] the Prophet explained it as "love of the world and dislike of death"
words.name: Wahn (وهن)

words.def: obligatory or mandatory see fard
words.name: Wājib (واجب)

words.def: friend, protector, guardian, supporter, helper
words.name: Walī (ولي)

words.def: An endowment of money or property: the return or yield is typically dedicated toward a certain end, for example, to the maintenance of the poor, a family, a village, or a mosque. Plural: awqaf
words.name: Waqf (وقف)

words.def: traditional scribe, publisher, printer, notary and book copier
words.name: Warrāq (ورّاق)

words.def: the middle way, justly balanced, avoiding extremes, moderation
words.name: Wasaṭ (وسط)

words.def: the means by which one achieves nearness to Allah (see tawassul )
words.name: Wasīlah (وسيلة)

words.def: a voluntary, optional night prayer of odd numbers rakaats.
words.name: Witr (وتر)

words.def: ablution for ritual purification from minor impurities before salat (see ghusl)
words.name: Wuḍūʾ (الوضوء)

words.def: O, God!
words.name: Yā Allāh (یا الله)

words.def: O, Messenger of God!. Term used by companions when interacting with Prophet Mohammad.
words.name: Ya Rasūl Allāh (یا رسول الله)

words.def: Gog and Magog
words.name: Yaʾjūj wa-Maʾjūj (يأجوج ومأجوج )

words.def: certainty, that which is certain
words.name: Yaqīn (يقين)

words.def: "May God have mercy on you", said when someone sneezes; the same as "(God) bless you" in English
words.name: Yarḥamuk-Allāh (يرحمك الله)

words.def: "May God have mercy of his/her soul", (said when someone dies)
words.name: Allāh Yarḥamuhu (الله يرحمه), fem. yarḥamuhā(يرحمها)

words.def: Day of Reckoning, Awe
words.name: Yawm ad-Dīn (يوم الدين)

words.def: Day of Rage, Wrath
words.name: Yawm al-Ghaḍab (يوم الغضب)

words.def: "Day of the Resurrection"; Day of Judgement
words.name: Yawm al-Qiyāmah (يوم القيامة)

words.def: the Psalms revealed to King Daoud (David) عليه السلام
words.name: Zabūr (زبور)

words.def: Islamic method of slaughtering an animal. Using a sharp knife the animal's windpipe, throat and blood vessels of the neck are severed without cutting the spinal cord to ensure that the blood is thoroughly drained before removing the head. See halal
words.name: Zabīḥa (Dhabīḥah) (ذَبِيْحَة) see dhabiha

words.def: Exterior meaning
words.name: Ẓāhir(ظاهر)

words.def: Islamic sub-sect of Shi'ah, popularly found in Yemen, with similarities to Sunni
words.name: Zaidi (الزيدية)

words.def: tax, alms, tithe as a Muslim duty; Sunnis regard this as the fourth Pillar of Islam. Neither charity nor derived from Islamic economics, but a religious duty and social obligation.
words.name: Zakāt (زكاة), Al-Māl

words.def: Charity given at the end of Ramadan.
words.name: Zakāt al-Fiṭr (زكاة الفطر)

words.def: polytheists, wrong-doers, and unjust.
words.name: Ẓālimūn (ظالمون)

words.def: heresy
words.name: Zandaqa (زندقة)

words.def: sexual activity outside of marriage (covering the English words adultery and fornication)
words.name: Zināʾ (زناء, زنى)

words.def: heretic, atheist
words.name: Zindīq (زنديق)

words.def: Sword of Ali رضي الله عنه, presented to him by Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم
words.name: Zulfiqar (Dhu-l-fiqār) (ذو الفقار)
